articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli jets launched strikes in Lebanon after the military assessed that the Iranian-backed Hezbollah movement was preparing to fire rockets and missiles towards Israel, the military said early on Sunday.
articles.title: Israeli military says jets striking in Lebanon

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 40,405 Palestinians have been killed and 93,468 others injured in Israel's military offensive on Gaza since Oct. 7, said the Gaza Health Ministry.
articles.title: 40,405 Palestinians killed in Israel's military offensive on Gaza since Oct. 7, Gaza health ministry says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said negotiations were ongoing with Saudi Arabia, Qatar, Turkey and Switzerland regarding the second summit on peace in a conversation with Indian journalists shared on his social media on Sunday.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy says he would support India hosting second summit on peace

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hezbollah leader Sayyed Hassan Nasrallah said on Sunday that his group would assess the impact of its rocket and drone attack on Israeli military targets earlier in the day before determining whether it would carry out further attacks to avenge a slain commander.
articles.title: Hezbollah chief says further strikes on Israel possible

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A member of the Reuters team covering the war in Ukraine was missing and two others were hospitalised after a strike on a hotel in the eastern Ukrainian city of Kramatorsk.
articles.title: Reuters staff hit in strike on hotel in Ukraine's Kramatorsk

articles.author: Ruma Paul
articles.description: Tens of thousands of Rohingya refugees rallied in camps in Bangladesh on Sunday on the seventh anniversary of the military crackdown that forced them to flee, demanding an end to violence and safe return to Myanmar.
articles.title: Rohingya demand end to violence on seventh anniversary of flight from Myanmar

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The suspect in custody for a stabbing rampage in the western German city of Solingen that killed three people and injured eight is a 26-year-old man who admitted to the crime, authorities said early on Sunday.
articles.title: German stabbing suspect is 26-year-old man who admitted to the crime

articles.author: Ruma Paul
articles.description: At least 20 people have died and more than 5.2 million have been affected in Bangladesh by floods caused by relentless monsoon rains and overflowing rivers, officials said on Sunday.
articles.title: Twenty dead, 5 million affected in Bangladesh floods

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Durov was traveling aboard his private jet, TF1 reported. It said police were investigating a lack of moderators on Telegram, which they thought allowed criminal activity to occur on the app.
articles.title: Telegram messaging app CEO Durov arrested in France

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Thirteen people including a Russian couple died in a mudslide on the Thai resort island of Phuket, the authorities said Sunday, after calling off a search for missing persons.
articles.title: Mudslide in Thailand's Phuket kills 13, including 2 Russians, official says
